titles.title: Disapproving the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of the People's Republic of China.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee Unfavorably.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported Adversely by the Yeas and Nays: 35 - 2.

action.text: Reported adversely by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 103-167.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 92.

action.text: Mr. McDermott asked unanimous consent that it be in order to consider the resolution in the House; that all points of order against the resolution and its consideration be waived; that the joint resolution be debated for one hour; that pursuant to sections 152 and 153 of the Trade Act of 1974, the previous question be considered as ordered without intervening motion; that the provisions of sections 152 and 153 of the Trade Act shall not apply to any other joint resolution of the 103rd Congress disapproving the extensionof most-favored nation treatment to the People's Republic of China recommended by the President.
Consideration initiated pursuant to prior agreement.
Mr. Solomon asked unanimous consent that the time for general debate on the resolution be extended to not to exceed one hour and ten minutes. Agreed to without objection.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the unanimous consent agreement of July 15, 1993, and the preceeding modification, the House proceeded with one hour and ten minutes of debate.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous order of the House.

vote.text: On passage Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 105 - 318 (Roll no. 347).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/8/1993--Introduced. Disapproves the recommendation of the President to extend nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of China.
